title: Does rabies vaccine protect you if you're exposed later?
body:
About 4 months ago i got rabies post exposure for a bat flying in my face. Was like 5 shots including the immunoglobulin.

 Recently a bat flew by me again and i'm unsure if it bit me or not but i know the tiny bats that are common where i live (florida) don't always draw blood from a bite.

I've heard mixed things and i know the standard protocol is you get another 2 doses of the VACCINE if you've already been treated before.

Do i realistically need it or should i be immune if i had all those shots only 4 months ago?
